routes.name: Fetch Current User Profile V2
routes.documentation:
# Resident API Get User Profile v2

## Endpoint

`GET /api/v2/users/me`

## Pagination

This endpoint does not support pagination.

## Parameters

This endpoint has no parameters.

## Responses

### 200 Response

```javascript
{
  "email": string,
  "first_name": string,
  "id": number,
  "last_name": string,
  "mobile_phone": string,
  "tos_accepted_at": datetime | null,
  "user_needs_to_accept_tos": boolean
}
```

 

Example Response:

```json
{
  "email": "test@test.com",
  "first_name": "John",
  "id": 1,
  "last_name": "Doe",
  "mobile_phone": "+14805555555",
  "tos_accepted_at": null,
  "user_needs_to_accept_tos": false
}
```

### 401 Response

Please use a valid access token in your request before continuing. This may require logging in or using your refresh token to obtain a new access token.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "unauthorized",
      "description": "Must include valid Authorization credentials"
    }
  ]
}
```

routes.name: Fetch User Profile by ID V2
List Units
routes.documentation:
# Units

## Endpoint

`GET /api/v1/units`

## Pagination

- `limit`: number, optional, example: (25) - the maximum number of records returned, may impact the total_pages value in the response so requests trying to fetch pages in series must use the same limit value.

 

```text
   If an invalid limit is provided, such as -1, a default limit of 1000 will be applied instead.
   If no limit is provided, a default of limit of 100 is applied.
```

 

- `page`: number, optional, example: (1) - the page to fetch. A client should not pass a page value greater than 1 without first getting a total_pages value indicating that this page is in a valid range.

 

```text
    If an invalid page is provided, such as -1, a 422 error will be returned.
    If no page is provided, a default of page of 1 is applied.
```

#### Example:

`/api/v1/units?limit=10&page=2`

```json
{
  "records": [],
  "total_records": 1000,
  "total_pages": 100,
  "current_page": 2
}
```

## Parameters

- `access_control_device_provider_id`: number, optional
- `available`: string, optional
- `building`: string, optional
- `buildings`: string, optional
- `can_be_toured`: string, optional
- `cities`: string, optional
- `countries`: string, optional
- `country`: string, optional
- `display_home_online`: string, optional
- `excluded_unit_ids`: string, optional
- `floor`: string, optional
- `floors`: string, optional
- `group_id`: number, optional
- `group_ids`: string, optional
- `has_access_control_device`: boolean, optional
- `has_any_lock`: boolean, optional
- `has_hub`: boolean, optional
- `has_primary_lock`: boolean, optional
- `hub_online`: string, optional
- `id`: number, optional
- `ids`: string, optional
- `is_occupied`: string, optional
- `limit`: number, optional, example: (25)
- `marketing_name`: string, optional
- `marketing_names`: string, optional
- `organization_id`: number, optional
- `organization_ids`: string, optional
- `page`: number, optional, example: (1)
- `property_code`: string, optional
- `qualifies_for_touring`: boolean, optional
- `remote_id`: string, optional
- `states`: string, optional
- `temperature_scale`: string, optional
- `unit_status`: string, optional
- `zips`: string, optional

Sample path with query string: `GET /api/v1/units?limit=25&page=1`

## Responses

### 200 Response

```javascript
  {
    "id": number,
    "group_id": number,
    "group": {
      "id": number,
      "uuid": string,
      "organization_id": number,
      "marketing_name": string,
      "street_address_1": string | null,
      "street_address_2": string | null,
      "city": string | null,
      "state": string | null,
      "zip": string | null,
      "country": string,
      "timezone": string | null,
      "rentcafe_id": null,
      "parking_enabled": boolean,
      "sync_interval": number | null,
      "temperature_scale": string | null,
      "property_code": string | null,
      "store_url": string | null,
      "wifi_provider_url": string | null,
      "group_white_label_config": { logo_url: string | null } | null,
      "community_wifi_enabled": boolean,
      "compound_psk_enabled": boolean,
      "has_intercom": boolean,
      "integrations": {
        "entrata_enabled": boolean
      },
      "managed_wifi": {
        "wifi_enabled": boolean,
        "marketing_enabled": boolean | null,
        "download_speed": string | null,
        "compound_psk_enabled": boolean | null,
        "wifi_monthly_cost": string | null,
        "enable_non_anonymized_resident_email": boolean | null,
        "enable_elp_resident_wifi_experience": boolean | null
      },
    },
    "image_url": string | null,
    "marketing_name": string,
    "ring_enabled": boolean,
    "temperature_scale": string,
    "timezone": string,
    "hub_id": number | null,
    "has_hub": boolean,
    "portal_only": boolean, // a unit with no community access and no devices
    "parking_enabled": boolean, // parking is enabled for this property
    "livly_enabled": boolean, // livly is enabled for this property
    "service_requests_enabled": boolean, // service requests is enabled for this property
    "broadcast_messages_enabled": boolean, // broadcast messages is enabled for this property
    "security_system_enabled": boolean, // a security system is enabled for this property
    "hub": {
      "id": number,
      "serial": string,
      "online": boolean,
      "type": string,
      "firmware": string | null,
      "unit_id": number,
      "timezone": string | null,
      "wifi_supported": boolean,
      "connection": string | null,
      "hub_account_id": number | null
    } | null,
    "unit_code": string | null,
    "building": string | null,
    "floor": string | null,
    "street_address_1": string | null,
    "street_address_2": string | null,
    "city": string | null,
    "state": string | null,
    "country": string | null,
    "zip": string | null
  }[]
```

### 401 Response

Please use a valid access token in your request before continuing. This may require logging in or using your refresh token to obtain a new access token.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "unauthorized",
      "description": "Must include valid Authorization credentials"
    }
  ]
}
```

### 403 Response

Forbidden

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "forbidden",
      "description": "This action is forbidden."
    }
  ]
}
```

### 404 Response

Not Found

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "not_found",
      "description": "The resource was not found."
    }
  ]
}
```

```javascript
    "country": string | null,

  }[]
```

routes.name: v2 List Scenes (by unit)
routes.documentation:
# Unit Scenes

## Endpoint

`GET /api/v2/units/:unit_id/scenes`

## Parameters

No parameters are passed to this endpoint

### 200 Response

```javascript
{
  total_records: number,
  total_pages: number,
  current_page: number,
  records: [
    {
      id: number,
      color: string,
      name: string,
      icon: string,
      device_states: [
        {
          id: number,
          attribute: string,
          device_name: string | null,
          device_id: number,
          target_state: string,
          device_type: string
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
```

### 403 Response

Forbidden

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "forbidden",
      "description": "This action is forbidden."
    }
  ]
}
```

routes.name: Fetch Unit Access (Pin, Fob, Mobile)
List Building Access Codes
routes.documentation:
# List Building Access Codes

## Endpoint

`GET /api/v2/units/:unit_id/building-access-codes`

## Pagination

This endpoint does not support pagination.

## Parameters

No parameters are passed to this endpoint.

## Responses

### 200 Response

```javascript
{
  "code": string,
  "end_at": datetime,
  "id": number,
  "start_at": datetime,
  "type": string
}
```

### 401 Response

Please use a valid access token in your request before continuing. This may require logging in or using your refresh token to obtain a new access token.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "unauthorized",
      "description": "Must include valid Authorization credentials"
    }
  ]
}
```

### 403 Response

Forbidden

A response with an HTTP status code of 404 with an error indicating the resource could not be found.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "field": null,
      "description": "You do not have permission to view this page",
      "code": "forbidden"
    }
  ]
}
```

### 404 Response

Not Found

A response with an HTTP status code of 404 with an error indicating the resource could not be found.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "field": null,
      "description": "The resource was not found",
      "code": "not_found"
    }
  ]
}
```

routes.name: Activity Log Search
routes.documentation:
# Activity 2.0

## Endpoint
  - /api/v2/units/:unit_id/activity

## Parameters
  - `lease_id`: integer, optional
  - `device_id`: integer, optional
  - `confirmed_at`: datetime, optional
  - `category`: string, optional
    - One of: `devices`, `security`
  - `start`: datetime, optional
  - `end`: datetime, optional
  - `page`: integer, optional

## Response
```json
{
  "records": [
    {
      "category": string,
      "caused_by": string | null,
      "description": string,
      "device": string,
      "event": string,
      "event_raw": string,
      "id": uuid,
      "inserted_at": datetime,
      "subject": string,
      "unit": {
        "marketing_name": string
      }
    }
  ],
  "total_pages": 2,
  "total_records": 2
}
```

## Errors
```
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": string,
      "description": string
    }
  ]
}
```

## Dev Notes
- Pagination is pseudo pagination. There will always be a next page until there are no more records to return

Get Zendesk JWT Token for User
List Devices (by unit, v3)
routes.documentation:
# List Unit Devices

## Endpoint

`GET /api/v3/units/:unit_id/devices`

## Changelog

- Added `pending_state` and `pending_state_requested_at` to the response to represent the desired, but not confirmed state of the attribute
- Changed `state` and `last_read_at` to no longer return the desired state and only returns the last known/confirmed state

## Responses

### 200 Response

```javascript
{
  current_page: number,
  total_pages: number,
  total_records: number,
  records: [{
    "id": number,
    "icon": string | null,
    "battery_level": number,
    "battery_powered": boolean,
    "primary_lock": boolean,
    "show_on_dashboard": boolean,
    "type": string,
    "updated_at": string | null,
    "valid_config": boolean,
    "warning": boolean,
    "pending_update": boolean,
    "online": boolean,
    "name": string,
    "inserted_at": string | null,
    "room": {
      "hub_id": number,
      "icon": string | null,
      "id": number,
      "inserted_at": string | null,
      "name": string,
      "updated_at": string | null
    },
    "attributes": [
    {
        "last_read_at": string,
        "name": string,
        "state": string,
        "pending_state": string | null,
        "pending_state_requested_at" string | null
    }
  ]
  }]
}
```

### 401 Response

Please use a valid access token in your request before continuing. This may require logging in or using your refresh token to obtain a new access token.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "unauthorized",
      "description": "Must include valid Authorization credentials"
    }
  ]
}
```

### 403 Response

Forbidden

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "forbidden",
      "description": "This action is forbidden."
    }
  ]
}
```

routes.name: Get Resident Preferences
Get Resident Notifications
routes.documentation:
# Get Resident Notifications

Users of the SmartRent Resident app can opt into or out of push notifications to their devices. In addition to having push notifications delivered to their devices in realtime, residents may query a history of notifications and are able to review important alerts even when opting out of push notifications. Resident notifications may be marked as read and filtered by read/unread status. See **Mark Resident Notifications as Read** and **Mark Notifications as Unread** endpoints.

## `GET /api/v1/resident-notifications`

Returns a paginated list of resident notifications for the currently authenticated user, sorted with the most recent notifications first.

### Query String Parameters

All parameters are optional. Filters are additive.

- `ids`: Filter to only notifications with the given ids. Comma-separated values
- `event_type`: Filter notifications by their event type. Comma-separated values
- `communication_preference_category`: Filter notifications by their push preferences category. Comma-separated values
- `unit_id`: Filter notifications by unit. Comma-separated values
- `inserted_at_after`: Filter to notifications that were delivered after the given ISO timestamp
- `inserted_at_before`: Filter to notifications that were delivered before the given ISO timestamp
- `is_read`: If `true`, filters to notifications with a non-null `read_at` timestamp; if `false`, filters to notifications with a null `read_at` timestamp
- `read_at_after`: Filter to notifications that were marked as read after the given ISO timestamp
- `read_at_before`: Filter to notifications that were marked as read before the given ISO timestamp
- `page`: Page number
- `limit`: Max records to return per page (default: 25)

Some notification event types also have additional metadata stored with the notification, called _custom data_, which varies for each type. Query string parameters with names that start with `custom_data.` can be applied to filter the results. The parameter value is also treated as comma-separated.

Example request to get unread all notifications for a particular unit:

```
GET /api/v1/resident-notifications?unit_id=1&is_read=false
```

Example request to get only specific types of notifications:

```
GET /api/v1/resident-notifications?unit_id=1&event_type=ring_ding,ring_motion
```

Example request to get only notifications created within a certain time range:

```
GET /api/v1/resident-notifications?inserted_at_after=2023-11-01T00:00:00.000Z&inserted_at_before=2023-11-08T23:59:59.999Z
```

Example request to get notifications based on custom_data fields:

```
GET /api/v1/resident-notifications?event_type=broadcast-message-create&custom_data.broadcast_message_id=8fc449de-436d-4b19-9614-6890ba2be29a,76e17378-7b19-443f-ac9e-214e17eb981e
```

### Responses

#### 200 Response

Resident notifications are returned as a paginated response, sorted by the `inserted_at` timestamp descending (i.e. with most recent notifications first).

```typescript
{
  records: {
    id: number; // positive integer
    event_type:
      | "away_mode_disabled"
      | "broadcast-message-create"
      | "code_replacement_failed"
      | "guest_access_code_used"
      | "humidity_alert"
      | "intercom_call"
      | "leak_detected"
      | "lock_jammed"
      | "low_battery"
      | "pm_code_used"
      | "ring_battery"
      | "ring_ding"
      | "ring_motion"
      | "security_event"
      | "service-request-complete"
      | "service-request-create"
      | "service-request-note-create"
      | "service-request-reopen"
      | "temperature_alert"
      | "work_order_code_used"
      | "work_order_completed"
      | "work-order-created";
    communication_preference_category:
      | "access"
      | "alerts"
      | "maintenance"
      | "push_broadcast_messaging"
      | "ring_battery"
      | "ring_ding"
      | "ring_motion"
      | "security"
      | "service_request_closed"
      | "service_request_comment_created"
      | "service_request_created"
      | "service_request_reopened";
    title: string;
    body: string;
    unit_id: number; // positive integer
    custom_data: Record<string, any>;
    read_at: string | null; // ISO timestamp
    inserted_at: string; // ISO timestamp
  }[];
  current_page: number; // positive integer
  total_pages: number; // positive integer
  total_records: number; // non-negative integer
}
```

Example:

```json
{
  "records": [
    {
      "id": 1454,
      "event_type": "security_event",
      "communication_preference_category": "security",
      "title": "Security Alert",
      "body": "There is activity on one or more of your security sensors. Security Camera was triggered at 3:05pm. Click to view the current status.",
      "custom_data": {
        "event_type": "security_event",
        "unit_id": 1,
        "device_id": 52
      },
      "read_at": null,
      "unit_id": 1,
      "inserted_at": "2023-10-03T00:06:22.184899"
    }
  ],
  "current_page": 1,
  "total_pages": 1,
  "total_records": 1
}
```

#### 403 Response

If the currently authenticated user is not a resident, a 403 status code is returned.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "forbidden",
      "description": "This action is forbidden."
    }
  ]
}
```

#### 401 Response

Please use a valid access token in your request before continuing. This may require logging in or using your refresh token to obtain a new access token.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "unauthorized",
      "description": "Must include valid Authorization credentials"
    }
  ]
}
```

routes.name: List Packages
routes.documentation:
# List Packages

## Endpoint

`GET /api/v2/units/:unit_id/packages`

## Responses

### 200 Response

```javascript
{
  "total_records": integer,
  "total_pages": integer,
  "current_page": integer,
  "records": [
    {
      "carrier": string | null,
      "completed_at": string | null,
      "completed_by": string | null,
      "completed_by_id": string | null,
      "condition": string,
      "created_at": datetime,
      "created_by": {
        "display_name": string,
        "email": string,
        "id": uuid,
        "profile_image": string | null,
        "resident": boolean,
        "title": string
      },
      "created_by_id": uuid,
      "description": null,
      "id": uuid,
      "photos": [],
      "place": {
        "id": uuid,
        "name": string
      },
      "place_id": uuid,
      "status": string,
      "sub_type": string,
      "tracking_number": string,
      "unit": {
        "id": uuid,
        "name": string
      },
      "unit_id": uuid
    }
  ]
}
```

#### Example

```javascript
{
  "total_records": 1,
  "total_pages": 1,
  "current_page": 1,
  "records": [
    {
      "carrier": null,
      "completed_at": null,
      "completed_by": null,
      "completed_by_id": null,
      "condition": "good",
      "created_at": "2024-02-15T19:08:42.433Z",
      "created_by": {
        "display_name": "Package t",
        "email": "package@test.com",
        "id": "634603e6-aaec-4010-ac47-465f3e9040e2",
        "profile_image": null,
        "resident": false,
        "title": "Software Engineer"
      },
      "created_by_id": "634603e6-aaec-4010-ac47-465f3e9040e2",
      "description": null,
      "id": "9be8188e-256c-4e09-9560-a895ae35f34a",
      "photos": [],
      "place": {
        "id": "5b5b260d-c437-48f0-ad99-7bcde7ae585b",
        "name": "999"
      },
      "place_id": "5b5b260d-c437-48f0-ad99-7bcde7ae585b",
      "status": "notified",
      "sub_type": "handheld-box",
      "tracking_number": "7895365412359875",
      "unit": {
        "id": "5b5b260d-c437-48f0-ad99-7bcde7ae585b",
        "name": "999"
      },
      "unit_id": "5b5b260d-c437-48f0-ad99-7bcde7ae585b"
    }
  ]
}
```

### 401 Response

Please use a valid access token in your request before continuing. This may require logging in or using your refresh token to obtain a new access token.

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "unauthorized",
      "description": "Must include valid Authorization credentials"
    }
  ]
}
```

### 403 Response

Forbidden

```json
{
  "errors": [
    {
      "code": "forbidden",
      "description": "This action is forbidden."
    }
  ]
}
```
